StringTable.Label: Promotion_Minister_Dec
StringTable.String: A department is far more effective when it has political support, and nothing communicates that like installing a Minister there.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Mobster_Dec
StringTable.String: It's amazing how many people are willing to do things for you when you subtly threaten their life. Or explicitly. The Mobster can go both ways.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Supreme_General_Dec
StringTable.String: One of the keenest military minds in our civilization. Looks good in a uniform, too. A Supreme General increases Legions.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Admiral_Dec
StringTable.String: After spending a lifetime amongst the stars, the Admiral knows more about space combat than anyone alive. And loneliness. Upgrades to a Flagship which gives a powerful fleet wide bonus.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Admiral_ActionTriggerDec_0
StringTable.String: [ICON=ProductionSubWnd_Military_Entry] Upgrades Command ship to Flag ship.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Navigator_Dec
StringTable.String: No-one sees the folds of space better or can cut the corners of reality quite like a Navigator. Upgrades to Star Surfer, a powerful long-range survey ship.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Navigator_ActionTriggerDec_0
StringTable.String: [ICON=ProductionSubWnd_Military_Entry] Upgrades Command ship to Navigator ship.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Invader_Dec
StringTable.String: The survivor of countless battles, and an expert on all forms of combat, the Invader hasn't met an alien yet that he can't subdue. Upgrades to a powerful Transport for invasions.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Privateer_Dec
StringTable.String: A master of tricks and subterfuge, the Privateer can harry the enemy without letting them know who they really work for. Converts ship into a powerful ship that seemingly belongs to no Civilization.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Exterminator_Dec
StringTable.String: A heartless genius, but aren't they all, the Exterminator can use their cruel gift to wipe out all the life on a world. Converts ship into a deadly Spore ship capable of eradicating all Biological life on a planet.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Exterminator_ActionTriggerDec_0
StringTable.String: [ICON=ProductionSubWnd_Military_Entry] Upgrades Command ship to Spore ship.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Martyr_Dec
StringTable.String: No-one loves our people (or hates the enemy) like the Martyr. They'll give everything to see our people prosper. Upgrades to Martyr which destroys itself and any enemy fleet it comes into contact with.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Infiltrator_Dec
StringTable.String: You could stare right at them and not know what they look like, the Infiltrator's only defining feature being their incredibly sticky fingers.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Infiltrator_ActionTriggerDec_0
StringTable.String: [ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] Infliltrator steals a random tech before getting caught.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Worker_Crunch Time_Dec
StringTable.String: Your workers tend to burn out when forced to work crunch time, but if you need a project done right now, what choice do you have? Worker finishes planet's current project and becomes a Retiree.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Worker_Recall_Dec
StringTable.String: Don't leave a productive worker spinning their wheels somewhere. Reassign them where they'll be more useful. Worker leaves the planet to work for the government or be sent somewhere else.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Worker_Recall_ActionTriggerDec_0
StringTable.String: [ICON=Stat_Productive_Icon] Worker is recalled to global pool.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Worker_Forced_labor_Dec
StringTable.String: Forced labor tends to burn up workers, but there's not arguing with the results. Unless you're the worker. Generates a burst of Social Construction on target planet.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Worker_Overtime_Dec
StringTable.String: It tends to shorten their careers, but overtime can certainly make your workers more productive for a short time. Overtime provides short burst to Social Constuction for all your colonies.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Epiphany_Dec
StringTable.String: They might not manage anything else in their careers, but few will care if a scientist makes a breakthrough big enough.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Coerced_Invention_Dec
StringTable.String: Even creative work can be forced, though it does tend to burn out the minds doing it. The sacrifice returns a large amount of research.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Scientist_Recall_Dec
StringTable.String: Sometimes you need to move a researcher where they can do more good. To a planet with better microscopes? Sure.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Scientist_Recall_ActionTriggerDec_0
StringTable.String: [ICON=Total_Research_Stat_Icon] Scientist is recalled to global pool.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Bumper_Crop_Dec
StringTable.String: If you need food now, your farmers can probably get it for you. They just might reconsider their careers when they're done. Bumper crop increases planetary food production.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Engineer_Forced_Labor_Dec
StringTable.String: Engineers can't lift much themselves, but they can tell people how to lift things better. The resulting unpopularity tends to shorten their careers though. This generates a burst of shipyard Construction.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Engineer_Crunch_Time_Dec
StringTable.String: When a ship needs to get done right this very instant, the welfare of your Engineers sometimes takes a backseat. The sacrifice finishes the nearest shipyard's project.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Engineer_Recall_Dec
StringTable.String: Move an Engineer to where they're needed most. They honestly don't mind.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Engineer_Recall_ActionTriggerDec_0
StringTable.String: [ICON=Engineers_Ability_Icon] Engineer is recalled to global pool.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Scholar_Dec
StringTable.String: A little bit of theoretical knowledge can improve the productivity of almost any enterprise.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Ambassador_Dec
StringTable.String: No-one knows local customs and cool alien handshakes quite like an Ambassador. Ambassadors generate 10 influence points per turn on whatever planet they are on.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Statesmen_Dec
StringTable.String: A diplomat can retire to the quiet life of a statesmen. But in the process they can generate 1000 influence for the planet they are currently settled on.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Diplomat_Recall_Dec
StringTable.String: Move your Ambassadors where they're needed most. To the people who really like you, maybe. Or the ones who really, really hate you.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Mogul_Dec
StringTable.String: The Entrepreneur takes his company public generation a vast fortune for himself and a capital gains for the government of 5000bc. Retires upon completion.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Saboteur_Dec
StringTable.String: An expert in explosives, infrastructure, and treachery, the Saboteur will wreck your enemy's whole day, and then some. [ICON=Stat_Productive_Icon] Irridiates the planet. Requires Level 5.

StringTable.Label: Promotion_Galactic_Tour_Dec
StringTable.String: Sending your Celebrity out on tour will help increase your Influence (and their album sales) tremendously. The tour increases your global Influence by a modest amount.
